socialEngineering.name: Phishing
socialEngineering.description: Fraudulent attempts to obtain sensitive information by disguising as trustworthy entities in electronic communications.
socialEngineering.prevention: Verify sender identity, don't click suspicious links

socialEngineering.name: Pretexting
socialEngineering.description: Creating a fabricated scenario to obtain information or access from a target.
socialEngineering.prevention: Verify caller identity, follow security protocols

socialEngineering.name: Spear Phishing
socialEngineering.description: Targeted phishing attacks directed at specific individuals or organizations.

socialEngineering.name: Whaling
socialEngineering.description: Phishing attacks specifically targeting senior executives and high-profile individuals.

malware.name: Ransomware
malware.description: Malicious software that encrypts files and demands payment for decryption.

malware.name: Trojan Horse
malware.description: Malicious software disguised as legitimate software to gain access to systems.

malware.name: Virus
malware.description: Self-replicating malware that spreads by infecting other files and programs.

malware.name: Spyware
malware.description: Software that secretly monitors and collects information about users.

network.name: DDoS Attack
network.description: Distributed Denial of Service attacks that overwhelm servers with traffic.

network.name: Man-in-the-Middle
network.description: Attackers intercept and potentially alter communications between two parties.

network.name: Password Attack
network.description: Various methods to crack or bypass password authentication.

webApplication.name: SQL Injection
webApplication.description: Inserting malicious SQL code into input fields to manipulate databases.

webApplication.name: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS)
webApplication.description: Injecting malicious scripts into web pages viewed by other users.

webApplication.name: Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF)
webApplication.description: Tricking users into performing unwanted actions on web applications.

webApplication.name: Directory Traversal
webApplication.description: Accessing files and directories outside the web root directory.
